text.__SUMMARY__: Odostomia electa is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Pyramidellidae, the pyrams and their allies.
text.Description:
The shell grows to a length of 2.1 mm.
The thin shell is nearly transparent, glossy, with microscopical growthlines. There are four, rather swollen whorls with a deep suture. The umbilicus is small and narrow. The columella has a superior, small, sunken tooth.
text.Distribution:
This species occurs in the following locations:
European waters (ERMS scope) : North Sea to the Bay of Cadiz
United Kingdom Exclusive Economic Zone
